intro.introduction: I am a current college junior majoring in Psychology and CS at Carleton College, MN.

psych.introduction: I like studying and thinking about psychology, particularly social and cultural psychology. The study of psychology has shown me how to fairly and critically examine ideas and thoughts, and it has helped me find ways to understand myself and to position myself in the world.

research.title: Perspective-Taking and Sinophobia
research.description: This research project was conducted in the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic in America. We were interested in applying a well-tested intervention called perspective-taking (Todd & Galinsky, 2014) to address the rise in anti-Chinese and anti-Asian attitudes in the current environment. The study was presented in the 2021 Anual Convention of Society for Personality and Social Psychology.

research.title: Emotion Perception and Cultures
research.description: I had always heard about the intrinsicality and cross-cultural similarity of emotion expressions (Ekman et al. 1972), but more recent research has been noticing the cross-cultural differences of emotions and turning to psychological constructionism to understand emotions and emotion perception.
